rs.ac.ns.ftn.tmd.datatypes
Interface FuzzySet

All Known Implementing Classes:
CrispSet, DecomposedFuzzyNumber, FuzzyInterval, LRFuzzyNumber, ScalarNumber
public interface FuzzySet

A class which defines operations Fuzzy Numbers have to support, independantly to its inner implementation. Generally operations of fuzzy arithmetics are defined here.

Author:
Nikola Kolarovic

Method Detail

add

FuzzySet add(FuzzySet arg2)
Fuzzy operation for addition of two fuzzy numbers.
First argument for the operation is the current object, and second argument is given as a function parameter.

Method can return UncompatibileFuzzyArithmeticsException RuntimeException if fuzzy number implementations are not compatibile!

Parameters:
arg2 - second argument for the operation
Returns:
number which is the result of the operation

substract

FuzzySet substract(FuzzySet arg2)
Fuzzy operation for substraction of two fuzzy numbers.
First argument for the operation is the current object, and second argument is given as a function parameter.

Method can return UncompatibileFuzzyArithmeticsException RuntimeException if fuzzy number implementations are not compatibile!

Parameters:
arg2 - second argument for the operation, which will be substracted from the current
Returns:
number which is the result of the operation

multiply

FuzzySet multiply(FuzzySet arg2)
Fuzzy operation for multiplication of two fuzzy numbers.
First argument for the operation is the current object, and second argument is given as a function parameter.

Parameters:
arg2 - second argument for the operation
Returns:
number which is the result of the operation
Throws:
UncompatibileFuzzyArithmeticsException - if fuzzy number implementations are not compatibile

divide

FuzzySet divide(FuzzySet arg2)
Fuzzy operation for division of two fuzzy numbers.
First argument for the operation is the current object, and second argument is given as a function parameter.

Parameters:
arg2 - second argument for the operation
Returns:
number which is the result of the operation
Throws:
UncompatibileFuzzyArithmeticsException - if fuzzy number implementations are not compatibile
FuzzyDivisionByZeroException - if number's confidence interval contains value 0

divideScalar

FuzzySet divideScalar(double arg2)

addScalar

FuzzySet addScalar(double arg2)
Fuzzy operation for addition between current FuzzyNumber and a scalar (double) value.
First argument for the operation is the current object, and second argument is given as a function parameter.

Parameters:
arg2 - constant which will be added as a crisp number
Returns:
number which is the result of the operation

multiplyScalar

FuzzySet multiplyScalar(double arg2)
Fuzzy operation for multiplication between current FuzzyNumber and a scalar (double) value.
First argument for the operation is the current object, and second argument is given as a function parameter.
Also for negation of FuzzyNumber, use multiplyScalar(-1).

Parameters:
arg2 - constant which will be multiplied as a crisp number
Returns:
number which is the result of the operation

getMultiplicationInverse

FuzzySet getMultiplicationInverse()
Calculates new FuzzyNumber which represents the multiplication inverse fuzzy number for the current one.
Basically, it is fuzzy 1/X function.

Returns:
fuzzy 1/X number
Throws:
FuzzyDivisionByZeroException - if number's confidence interval contains value 0

getMembershipValue

double getMembershipValue(double universalValue)
Calculates value of the membership function of a fuzzy number for given value.

Parameters:
universalValue - Value in universal (real) set for which we calculate membership function
Returns:
value of the membership function in given point -> [0,1]

getModalValue

double getModalValue()
Calculates the modal value of a fuzzy number
Modal value is the universal value in which membership function value is reaching 1.

Returns:
value of X where membershipFunction(X) == 1

getLeftBoundary

double getLeftBoundary()
Calculates left boundary of a fuzzy number. It is value of the worst case interval on the left side, value in which membership function has value 0+.

Returns:
left boundary value in universal set X

getRightBoundary

double getRightBoundary()
Calculates right boundary of a fuzzy number. It is value of the worst case interval on the right side, value in which membership function has value 0+.

Returns:
right boundary value in universal set X

getLeftSpread

double getLeftSpread()
Calculates value of left spread, which is distance from the modal value to the left boundary.

Returns:
distance from modal value to left boundary, which is always >0

getRightSpread

double getRightSpread()
Calculates value of right spread, which is distance from the modal value to the right boundary.

Returns:
distance from modal value to right boundary, which is always >0

distance

FuzzySet distance(FuzzySet arg2)
Operacion que implementa la distancia numerica entre 2 objetos de tipo FuzzySet. Dada la de tipos de datos existentes (cualquier dato de este paquete implementa la clase FuzzySet) existiran muchas combinaciones distintas y el tipo del resultado dependera de ello. Por ejemplo, la distancia entre un escalar y un conjunto numerico es otro conjunto numerico; pero la distancia entre un escalar y un numero borroso es otro numero borroso.

Parameters:
arg2 -
Returns:
Un objeto FuzzySet con la distancia entre los 2 parametros

substractScalar

FuzzySet substractScalar(double arg2)
Resta un valor real al dato que llama a este metodo.

Parameters:
arg2 -
Returns:

sqrt

FuzzySet sqrt()
Aplica una raiz cuadrada al dato que llama a este metodo. El tipo del resultado sera el mismo que el tipo del dato que hace la llamada.

Returns:
Objeto FuzzySet con el resultado de aplicar la raiz cuadrada

pow

FuzzySet pow(int pot)
Eleva el dato que llama a este metodo a la potencia que indica el parametro recibido. El tipo del dato que retorna sera el mismo que el tipo del dato que realiza la llamada.

Parameters:
pot - potencia a la que elevar el dato
Returns:

existsImprecision

boolean existsImprecision()
Returns:
true si el dato que llama a este metodo tiene imprecision simple (es un conjunto numerico o dato borroso) y false en caso de que no tenga imprecision (un escalar)

existsFuzzyImprecision

boolean existsFuzzyImprecision()
Returns:
true si existe incertidumbre de tipo borrosa en el dato que llama a este metodo y false en caso de que no la tenga (que sea un dato exacto o con incertidumbre simple).

distrust

FuzzySet distrust(float minDistrust,
                  float maxDistrust)
Este metodo aplica una desconfianza por debajo y por arriba al dato que llama a este metodo. Por ejemplo si aplicamos desconfianza a un escalar exacto se transformara en un conjunto numerico.

Parameters:
minDistrust -
maxDistrust -
Returns:

getRightFunction

int getRightFunction()
Solo tiene sentido llamar a este metodo desde un dato borroso (numero o intervalo)

Returns:
El identificador del tipo de funcion de la rama derecha del dato borroso.

getLeftFunction

int getLeftFunction()
Solo tiene sentido llamar a este metodo desde un dato borroso (numero o intervalo)

Returns:
El identificador del tipo de funcion de la rama izquierda del dato borroso.

getStrType

java.lang.String getStrType()
Sirve como complemento del toString().

Returns:
Un String con el nombre del tipo de dato que llama a este metodo.
